alert.note: Alert for Caledonia; Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Eastern Franklin; Eastern Rutland; Essex; Lamoille; Orange; Orleans; Washington; Western Addison; Western Chittenden; Western Franklin; Western Rutland; Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 19 at 2:45PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Briefly heavy snow will impact portions of Lamoille, Caledonia, Orange, Orleans, northwestern Essex, eastern Addison, northeastern Rutland, eastern Chittenden, northern Windsor, Washington and eastern Franklin Counties through 345 PM EST... At 244 PM EST, areas of moderate to briefly heavy snow were reported along a line extending from near Montgomery Center to Rochester. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds 25 mph or greater, and visibility less than a half mile. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds may blow around unsecured objects. Low visibility will pose a hazard to motorists. Locations impacted include... Barre, Montpelier, Newport City, Lyndon, St. Johnsbury, Morrisville, Enosburg Falls, Orleans, Derby Center, Charleston, Jay, Braintree Hill, Bradford, Newport Town, Cambridge, Glover, Waterbury Village, Montgomery Center, Websterville and Albany. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 12 and 76. Interstate 91 between mile markers 80 and 90, and between mile markers 140 and 177.
info.instruction: Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.

area.areaDesc: Caledonia; Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Eastern Franklin; Eastern Rutland; Essex; Lamoille; Orange; Orleans; Washington; Western Addison; Western Chittenden; Western Franklin; Western Rutland; Windsor
